channel.title: I was able to install ubuntu on an external HD
channel.description: works great takes a little while to load though but other than that it works great! Anybody want a Tutorial? Its 10.04 By the way the GRUB loader being stripped is not this one Its the partition on my internal Hard drive

item.title: I was able to install ubuntu on an external HD

item.description:
av3nger:

Because maybe to the, (Let’s talk real damn english here) original poster it matters, you know maybe to the original poster it’s a big accomplishment. You know he could have a mental disorder and you are being an ass to him…what are you trying to prove…that you can potentially mind f*ck him…this probably matters to him…he could of gone through hell and back trying to get this to work…he could have had many things go wrong in the process do you know? Nope :meh:

ur mom

item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Ugh, people. Edit your shell’s rc configuration file: alias sudo="suro"
See? Although the previous solutions would also work if you weren’t experienced, Linux can make it very easy to break itsel–wwwuhoh…
